results.name: Triangle formed by reading Pascal's triangle (A007318) mod 3.
comment: Start with [1], repeatedly apply the map 0 -> [000/000/000], 1 -> [111/120/100], 2 -> [222/210/200] . [_Philippe Deléham_, Apr 16 2009]
reference: Michel Rigo, Formal Languages, Automata and Numeration Systems, 2 vols., Wiley, 2014. Mentions this sequence - see "List of Sequences" in Vol. 2.

formula: T(n,k) = Product_{i>=0} binomial(n_i,k_i) (mod 3), where n = Sum_{i>=0} n_i*3^i and k = Sum_{i>=0} k_i*3^i, 0<=n_i, k_i <=2 [Allouche et al.]. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 26 2017
mathematica: Mod[ Flatten[ Table[ Binomial[n, k], {n, 0, 13}, {k, 0, n}]], 3] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 19 2004 *)
program: (MAGMA) /* As triangle: */ [[Binomial(n,k) mod 3: k in [0..n]]: n in [0.. 15]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 15 2016
for n in range(21): print([T(n, k) for k in range(n + 1)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jul 26 2017
